column4: iam running a amd 64 3800 and it dog slow,when i up load videofeed it almost stops.
is it a good idea to install windows over ubuntu dual boot ubuntu being frist
many people have said it's a pain, but assuming your windows is XP I find it muuuuch easier to do it the way you asked
I installed Ubuntu first, then Windows, and all I had to do was reinstall GRUB after windows took the liberty of overwriting it and it works fine now
yes its xp,i did do a dual boot windows being frist but ubuntu is up and got alot i want to keep
so you have windows already installed? or ubuntu installed?

yeah...it's easy. Just resize your partition to allow room for windows, install windows to the empty portion. Windows will overwrite grub in the mbr, so you have to repair GRUB after you install windows but once you do that you'll have both your current ubuntu and your new windows xp installs dual boot
ok thinks,can i use ubuntu disk to repair the mbr
yup. Just google "repair grub ubuntu livecd" and i think the first result is a great guide to walk you through it
i think i just notice something em i right? by putting your name frist it helps changer the color to be idenfi
yes ok notice you talking tome , it was in red
is this the right way to reload grub ?
